intro: Amanoa bracteata, commonly known as the Hawaiian bracteate amanoa, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy appearance. Amanoa bracteata plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian ecosystems and is considered a rare and endangered species.
